intro: Hieracium cieselskii, commonly known as the Cieselski's hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It produces yellow to orange flowers that bloom in the summer months. Its leaves are generally lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
